description: From Middle English injustice, from Old French injustice, from Latin iniustitia. Equivalent to in- +‎ justice. Displaced native Old English unrihtwīsnes.

entries.meaning: Violation of the rights of another person or people.
examples: Silence in the face of gross injustice, or support for it, or even active involvement therein, comes at a price.

entries.meaning: Unfairness; the state of not being fair or just.
